meanings.definition: The state or quality of being thick.
meanings.sent1: The cake's thickness made it difficult to cut into slices.
meanings.sent2: The painter added thickness to the brushstrokes for a bolder effect.
meanings.sent3: The thickness of the fog made it seem like a mysterious veil over the city.
meanings.sent4: The thickness of the plot in the movie kept the audience guessing until the end.
meanings.sent5: The thickness of the ice on the pond warned of the coming winter chill.

meanings.definition: The measurement of the distance between opposite sides of an object.
meanings.sent1: The thickness of the book was impressive, indicating a long read.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a ruler to measure the thickness of the wood before cutting.
meanings.sent3: The thickness of the traffic jam was so extreme that even the birds were stuck.
meanings.sent4: The thickness of the tension in the room could be felt by everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The thickness of the fabric determined its durability and quality.
